titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 77
CWG12164

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 1st - 20th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Primary Source Documents

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, February 16th, 1865.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 77}
(Extract.)

71. Private R. H. Thomason, a drafted man from the 4th District of Kentucky, assigned to the 18th Kentucky Veteran Volunteers, and now supposed to be with that regiment, will be discharged the service of the United States, upon the receipt of this Order at the place where he may be serving.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townssend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Generals office
Washington Feby. 16" 1865
"18 Infy"
18:
Townsend E.D.
A. A. G.
Order --
Discharging private R. H. Thomason, drafted from 4" Dist. Ky & assigned to 18" Ky Vet. Vols --
Recd A. G. O. Ky 2 Mar. 1865
